title: ISic003327. Part of a caduceus of the Adeonzinoi
body:
1Ἀδεονζίνο̄ν δαμόσ(ιον)

1ΑΔΕΟΝΖΙΝΟ̄ΝΔΑΜΟΣ

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text after Ampolo and Robert

translation

commentary

The Adeonzinoi are not identified. Some scholars (e.g. Guarducci) have interpreted this piece as a weight, rather than as an element from a caduceus, but the attribution to a caduceus is generally accepted.

bibliography

  • 56.1077.B1 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000796
  • Robert 1936 no.83 with pl. XLIII https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001271
  • Dubois 1989 201 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000187
  • Manganaro 1996 142 n.65 with tav. 15 fig. 15 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001821
  • Ampolo 2006 185 appendix B no.1 with fig. 8 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002458
  • Schwyzer 1923 311 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001230
  • Guarducci 1967-1978 vol. 2, p. 463 n.1 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000193
